get.description: List all guest configuration assignments for a subscription.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

schema.description: The response of the list guest configuration assignment operation.

value.description: Result of the list guest configuration assignment operation.

items.description: Guest configuration assignment is an association between a machine and guest configuration.

id.description: ARM resource id of the guest configuration assignment.

location.description: Region where the VM is located.

properties.description: Properties of the Guest configuration assignment.

kind.description: Kind of the guest configuration. For example:DSC

contentUri.description: Uri of the storage where guest configuration package is uploaded.

contentHash.description: Combined hash of the guest configuration package and configuration parameters.

contentManagedIdentity.description: Managed identity with storage access of the guest configuration package and configuration parameters.

assignmentType.description: Specifies the assignment type and execution of the configuration. Possible values are Audit, DeployAndAutoCorrect, ApplyAndAutoCorrect and ApplyAndMonitor.

assignmentSource.description: Specifies the origin of the configuration.

contentType.description: Specifies the content type of the configuration. Possible values could be Builtin or Custom.

configurationParameter.description: The configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationProtectedParameter.description: The protected configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationSetting.description: The configuration setting for the guest configuration.

configurationMode.description: Specifies how the LCM(Local Configuration Manager) actually applies the configuration to the target nodes. Possible values are ApplyOnly, ApplyAndMonitor, and ApplyAndAutoCorrect.

allowModuleOverwrite.description: If true - new configurations downloaded from the pull service are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node. Otherwise, false

actionAfterReboot.description: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration. The possible values are ContinueConfiguration and StopConfiguration

refreshFrequencyMins.description: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull service to get updated configurations. This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode. The default value is 30.

rebootIfNeeded.description: Set this to true to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied. Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it. The default value is false. To use this setting when a reboot condition is enacted by something other than DSC (such as Windows Installer), combine this setting with the xPendingReboot module.

configurationModeFrequencyMins.description: How often, in minutes, the current configuration is checked and applied. This property is ignored if the ConfigurationMode property is set to ApplyOnly. The default value is 15.

complianceStatus.description: A value indicating compliance status of the machine for the assigned guest configuration.

lastComplianceStatusChecked.description: Date and time when last compliance status was checked.

latestReportId.description: Id of the latest report for the guest configuration assignment.

parameterHash.description: parameter hash for the guest configuration assignment.

latestAssignmentReport.description: Last reported guest configuration assignment report.

id.description: ARM resource id of the report for the guest configuration assignment.

reportId.description: GUID that identifies the guest configuration assignment report under a subscription, resource group.

assignment.description: Configuration details of the guest configuration assignment.

name.description: Name of the guest configuration assignment.

id.description: Azure resource Id of the VM.

uuid.description: UUID(Universally Unique Identifier) of the VM.

startTime.description: Start date and time of the guest configuration assignment compliance status check.

endTime.description: End date and time of the guest configuration assignment compliance status check.

complianceStatus.description: A value indicating compliance status of the machine for the assigned guest configuration.

operationType.description: Type of report, Consistency or Initial

resources.description: The list of resources for which guest configuration assignment compliance is checked.

complianceStatus.description: A value indicating compliance status of the machine for the assigned guest configuration.

resourceId.description: Name of the guest configuration assignment resource setting.

reasons.description: Compliance reason and reason code for a resource.

items.description: Reason and code for the compliance of the guest configuration assignment resource.

phrase.description: Reason for the compliance of the guest configuration assignment resource.

code.description: Code for the compliance of the guest configuration assignment resource.

properties.description: Properties of a guest configuration assignment resource.

context.description: The source which initiated the guest configuration assignment. Ex: Azure Policy

assignmentHash.description: Combined hash of the configuration package and parameters.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

vmssVMList.description: The list of VM Compliance data for VMSS

vmResourceId.description: Azure resource Id of the VM.

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: vmssName
parameters.description: The name of the virtual machine scale set.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The guest configuration assignment name.

schema.description: Guest configuration assignment is an association between a machine and guest configuration.

id.description: ARM resource id of the guest configuration assignment.

location.description: Region where the VM is located.

properties.description: Properties of the Guest configuration assignment.

kind.description: Kind of the guest configuration. For example:DSC

contentUri.description: Uri of the storage where guest configuration package is uploaded.

contentHash.description: Combined hash of the guest configuration package and configuration parameters.

contentManagedIdentity.description: Managed identity with storage access of the guest configuration package and configuration parameters.

assignmentType.description: Specifies the assignment type and execution of the configuration. Possible values are Audit, DeployAndAutoCorrect, ApplyAndAutoCorrect and ApplyAndMonitor.

assignmentSource.description: Specifies the origin of the configuration.

contentType.description: Specifies the content type of the configuration. Possible values could be Builtin or Custom.

configurationParameter.description: The configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationProtectedParameter.description: The protected configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationSetting.description: The configuration setting for the guest configuration.

configurationMode.description: Specifies how the LCM(Local Configuration Manager) actually applies the configuration to the target nodes. Possible values are ApplyOnly, ApplyAndMonitor, and ApplyAndAutoCorrect.

allowModuleOverwrite.description: If true - new configurations downloaded from the pull service are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node. Otherwise, false

actionAfterReboot.description: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration. The possible values are ContinueConfiguration and StopConfiguration

refreshFrequencyMins.description: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull service to get updated configurations. This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode. The default value is 30.

rebootIfNeeded.description: Set this to true to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied. Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it. The default value is false. To use this setting when a reboot condition is enacted by something other than DSC (such as Windows Installer), combine this setting with the xPendingReboot module.

configurationModeFrequencyMins.description: How often, in minutes, the current configuration is checked and applied. This property is ignored if the ConfigurationMode property is set to ApplyOnly. The default value is 15.

complianceStatus.description: A value indicating compliance status of the machine for the assigned guest configuration.

lastComplianceStatusChecked.description: Date and time when last compliance status was checked.

latestReportId.description: Id of the latest report for the guest configuration assignment.

parameterHash.description: parameter hash for the guest configuration assignment.

latestAssignmentReport.description: Last reported guest configuration assignment report.

contentType.description: Specifies the content type of the configuration. Possible values could be Builtin or Custom.

configurationParameter.description: The configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationMode.description: Specifies how the LCM(Local Configuration Manager) actually applies the configuration to the target nodes. Possible values are ApplyOnly, ApplyAndMonitor, and ApplyAndAutoCorrect.

allowModuleOverwrite.description: If true - new configurations downloaded from the pull service are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node. Otherwise, false

actionAfterReboot.description: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration. The possible values are ContinueConfiguration and StopConfiguration

refreshFrequencyMins.description: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull service to get updated configurations. This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode. The default value is 30.

rebootIfNeeded.description: Set this to true to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied. Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it. The default value is false. To use this setting when a reboot condition is enacted by something other than DSC (such as Windows Installer), combine this setting with the xPendingReboot module.

allowModuleOverwrite.description: If true - new configurations downloaded from the pull service are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node. Otherwise, false

actionAfterReboot.description: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration. The possible values are ContinueConfiguration and StopConfiguration

refreshFrequencyMins.description: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull service to get updated configurations. This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode. The default value is 30.

rebootIfNeeded.description: Set this to true to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied. Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it. The default value is false. allowModuleOverwrite.description: If true - new configurations downloaded from the pull service are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node. Otherwise, false

actionAfterReboot.description: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration. The possible values are ContinueConfiguration and StopConfiguration

refreshFrequencyMins.description: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull service to get updated configurations. This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode. The default value is 30.

rebootIfNeeded.description: Set this to true to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied. Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it. The default value is false. To use this setting when a reboot condition is enacted by something other than DSC (such as Windows Installer), combine this setting with the xPendingReboot module.

configurationModeFrequencyMins.description: How often, in minutes, the current configuration is checked and applied. This property is ignored if the ConfigurationMode property is set to ApplyOnly. The default value is 15.

GuestConfigurationNavigation.description: Guest configuration is an artifact that encapsulates DSC configuration and its dependencies. The artifact is a zip file containing DSC configuration (as MOF) and dependent resources and other dependencies like modules.

kind.description: Kind of the guest configuration. For example:DSC

contentUri.description: Uri of the storage where guest configuration package is uploaded.

contentHash.description: Combined hash of the guest configuration package and configuration parameters.

contentManagedIdentity.description: Managed identity with storage access of the guest configuration package and configuration parameters.

assignmentType.description: Specifies the assignment type and execution of the configuration. Possible values are Audit, DeployAndAutoCorrect, ApplyAndAutoCorrect and ApplyAndMonitor.

assignmentSource.description: Specifies the origin of the configuration.

contentType.description: Specifies the content type of the configuration. Possible values could be Builtin or Custom.

configurationParameter.description: The configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationProtectedParameter.description: The protected configuration parameters for the guest configuration.

configurationSetting.description: The configuration setting for the guest configuration.

configurationMode.description: Specifies how the LCM(Local Configuration Manager) actually applies the configuration to the target nodes. Possible values are ApplyOnly, ApplyAndMonitor, and ApplyAndAutoCorrect.

allowModuleOverwrite.description: If true - new configurations downloaded from the pull service are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node. Otherwise, false

actionAfterReboot.description: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration. The possible values are ContinueConfiguration and StopConfiguration

refreshFrequencyMins.description: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull service to get updated configurations. This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode. The default value is 30.

rebootIfNeeded.description: Set this to true to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied. Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it. The default value is false. To use this setting when a reboot condition is enacted by something other than DSC (such as Windows Installer), combine this setting with the xPendingReboot module.

configurationModeFrequencyMins.description: How often, in minutes, the current configuration is checked and applied. This property is ignored if the ConfigurationMode property is set to ApplyOnly. The default value is 15.
